paper_abstract: We introduce a method to estimate parameters and states from a differential equation model while enforcing interpretability constraints such as monotone or non-negative states. We motivate the methodology using a real data chemical engineering example and show that a variety of restrictive constraints from earlier analyses do not address the problem of interpretability. Our proposed method estimates parameters using a smoothing-based relaxation of the model to enforce interpretability of the observed and unobserved system states. Copyright (c) 2012 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Parameter estimation in differential equation models with constrained states
